question: My wife had a hemmorhagic stroke due to complications of preeclampsia.  An emergency c-section was performed to save her life, as she had HELLP syndrome.  I authorized a craniotomy to relieve pressure to the brain.  She was in ICU for 1 week and CCU for 1 week.  She  had in hospital rehab for 2.5 weeks, and has been receiving home therapy for the past 3 weeks.  She can walk..with assistance, she has all cognitive abilities.  She suffers from severe dizziness and visual problems.  No double vision...she just says there is too much stuff she is seeing and it moves when she moves.  She says her left side feels heavy some times and light others.  For two days she said it felt like the other side but numb.  Then it was back to heavy.  Her biggest complaint is her visual problems.  Neuroopthamologist said no loss of sight.  She wakes every day and says my left side feels the same and I still cant see.  I try to remain optomistic, but I don't want to give false hope.  We are 2 months into this thing.  How much better wil she get?  I have 4 kids at home: 13, 5, 2, 0.  We depended on her income and mine.  I need to go back to work.  What kind of adult care do I look for.  We are 38 years old.  What do I do???
title: how long....really
